description: A 22-meter copper statue (51 meters with granite base) symbolizing peace through strength, erected in 1967 to replace Stalin's statue. Located in Victory Park on a hill overlooking Yerevan, the statue depicts a mother with sheathed sword and shield at her feet, designed by Ara Harutyunyan.
highlights: Panoramic views of Yerevan and Mount Ararat from Victory Park
Military Museum of Armenia housed within the pedestal since 1995
Historic significance - replaced Stalin statue that stood 1950-1962
Pedestal designed by Rafayel Israyelian to resemble Armenian basilica church
Guardian figure watching over the Armenian capital from strategic hilltop
tips: Best views during golden hour for photography
Visit Military Museum to learn about Armenia's role in WWII
Victory Park offers pleasant walking paths and outdoor activities
Combine with Cascade visit - both offer excellent viewpoints
vibe: Majestic and inspiring, standing as a proud symbol of Armenian strength and resilience while offering visitors breathtaking panoramic vistas of the capital
